meanings.definition: A line traced on a surface by a point moving in a fixed direction and at a constant angle to the surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist drew intricate heliclines on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The heliclines on the map showed the path of the airplane.
meanings.sent3: The heliclines in the sand looked like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts followed heliclines, never staying in one place for long.
meanings.sent5: The heliclines etched in stone told a story of ancient travelers.

meanings.definition: A curve traced on a surface by a point moving at a constant angle to the surface.
meanings.sent1: The heliclines of the rollercoaster made my stomach drop.
meanings.sent2: She studied the heliclines in math class to understand curves better.
meanings.sent3: The heliclines on the road made the car ride feel like a dance.
meanings.sent4: His words followed heliclines, circling back to the same point.
meanings.sent5: The heliclines of the river twisted and turned through the valley.
